rulesets.name: Standard
rulesets.description: No modification to the standard gameplay rules and mechanics.

rulesets.name: Back to Basics
rulesets.description: Monsters lose all abilities.

rulesets.name: Silenced Summoners
rulesets.description: Summoners do not give any stat buffs or debuffs or grant/use any abilities.

rulesets.name: Aim True
rulesets.description: Attacks always hit their target.

rulesets.name: Super Sneak
rulesets.description: All Melee attack Monsters have the Sneak ability.

rulesets.name: Weak Magic
rulesets.description: Magic attacks hit Armor before reducing Health.

rulesets.name: Unprotected
rulesets.description: Monsters do not have any armor and do not get armor from Abilities or Summoner Buffs.

rulesets.name: Target Practice
rulesets.description: All Ranged and Magic attack Monsters have the Snipe ability.

rulesets.name: Fog of War
rulesets.description: Monsters lose the Sneak, Snipe and Opportunity abilities.

rulesets.name: Armored Up
rulesets.description: All Monsters have 2 Armor in addition to their normal Armor stat.

rulesets.name: Healed Out
rulesets.description: All healing abilities are removed from Monsters and Summoners.

rulesets.name: Earthquake
rulesets.description: Non-flying Monsters take 2 Melee damage at the end of each round.

rulesets.name: Reverse Speed
rulesets.description: Monsters with the lowest Speed attack first and have the highest chance of evading attacks.

rulesets.name: Close Range
rulesets.description: Ranged attacks may be used in the first position in battles.

rulesets.name: Heavy Hitters
rulesets.description: All Monsters have the Knock Out ability.

rulesets.name: Equalizer
rulesets.description: The initial Health of all Monsters is equal to that of the Monster on either team with the highest base Health.

rulesets.name: Keep Your Distance
rulesets.description: Monsters with Melee attack may not be used in battles.

rulesets.name: Lost Legendaries
rulesets.description: Legendary Monsters may not be used in battles.

rulesets.name: Melee Mayhem
rulesets.description: Melee attack Monsters can attack from any position.

rulesets.name: Taking Sides
rulesets.description: Neutral Monsters may not be used in battles.

rulesets.name: Rise of the Commons
rulesets.description: Only Common and Rare Monsters may be used in battles.

rulesets.name: Up Close & Personal
rulesets.description: Only Monsters with Melee attack may be used in battles.

rulesets.name: Broken Arrows
rulesets.description: Ranged attack Monsters may not be used in battles.

rulesets.name: Little League
rulesets.description: Only Monsters & Summoners that cost 4 Mana or less may be used in battles.

rulesets.name: Lost Magic
rulesets.description: Monsters with Magic attack may not be used in battles.

rulesets.name: Even Stevens
rulesets.description: Only Monsters with even Mana costs may be used in battles.

rulesets.name: Odd Ones Out
rulesets.description: Only Monsters with odd Mana costs may be used in battles.

rulesets.name: Noxious Fumes
rulesets.description: All Monsters start the battle Poisoned.

rulesets.name: Stampede
rulesets.description: The Trample ability can trigger multiple times per attack if the trampled Monster is killed.

rulesets.name: Equal Opportunity
rulesets.description: All Monsters have the Opportunity ability.

rulesets.name: Explosive Weaponry
rulesets.description: All Monsters have the Blast ability.

rulesets.name: Thorns
rulesets.description: All Monsters have the Thorns ability.

rulesets.name: Briar Patch
rulesets.description: All Monsters have the Thorns ability.

rulesets.name: Magic Reflect
rulesets.description: All Monsters have the Magic Reflect ability.

rulesets.name: Counterspell
rulesets.description: All Monsters have the Magic Reflect ability.

rulesets.name: Holy Protection
rulesets.description: All Monsters have the Divine Shield ability.

rulesets.name: Return Fire
rulesets.description: All Monsters have the Return Fire ability.

rulesets.name: What Doesn’t Kill You
rulesets.description: All Monsters have the Enrage ability.

rulesets.name: Fire & Regret
rulesets.description: All Monsters have the Return Fire ability.

rulesets.name: Spreading Fury
rulesets.description: All Monsters have the Enrage ability.

rulesets.name: Tis but Scratches
rulesets.description: All Monsters have the Cripple ability.

rulesets.name: Up to Eleven
rulesets.description: All Monsters have the Amplify ability.

rulesets.name: Aimless
rulesets.description: All Monsters have the Scattershot ability.

rulesets.name: Ferocity
rulesets.description: All Monsters have the Fury ability.

rulesets.name: Going the Distance
rulesets.description: Only Monsters with Ranged attack may be used in battles.

rulesets.name: Wands Out
rulesets.description: Only Monsters with Magic attack may be used in battles.

rulesets.name: Knockin’ on Heaven’s Door
rulesets.description: All Monsters start the battle with 1 health.

rulesets.name: Are You Not Entertained?
rulesets.description: One additional Gladiator card may be used in battles.

data.description: Many of the fey races are especially adept at harnessing earth elemental mana, which is concentrated in the land itself. Imbue yourself with the essence of an earth summoner and win battles in the arena to perfect your mastery of it.
Through death, the Dark Eternals seek life everlasting. Learn the formidable tactics of the revenants by invoking a death summoner and using dark magic to find victory in the arena.

While life elemental mana is found within light and the heavens, it is also woven into the fabric of time and space. Do not be fooled, though. It can both heal and destroy. Invoke a life summoner and practice using life magic to destroy your opponent in the arena.

Don't be fooled by fanciful tales of sunshine and tropical beaches. The archipelago and abyssal waters of Azmare are brutal and violent. Learn to tame them by imbuing yourself with the essence of a water summoner and battling for glory in the arena.

The Torch believe that, one day, the Goddess Mitreyya will cleanse the Splinterlands in glorious fire. To prepare for her coming, hone your skills in the arena while imbued with the essence of a fire summoner.

Dragon magic comes from the dragons themselves and is infused with their will to dominate and control. Demonstrate your own control by invoking a dragon summoner and exerting your will to dominate your opponent.

It is often best to attack your opponent where they are unprepared and least expect it. Practice using Sneak, Snipe, or Opportunity to take your enemy by surprise and decimate their back row while winning as many arena battles as possible.

When facing melee and ranged attacks, the best defense isn’t necessarily a good offense. Sometimes it involves a sturdy shield, a tough hide, or a trusty armorer. Use Shield or Repair to weather the storm and see you through to victory.

A battle mage will rarely benefit from a prolonged fight against an opponent who uses spells of healing to sustain their forces. Practice using Tank Heal, Heal, Cleanse, or Triage to outlast your opponent in the arena.

The battle mage who occupies the high ground fights at an advantage. The battle mages who own the skies, however, hold the greatest advantage of all. Use units with Flying to rain destruction upon your opponent.

Securing yourself against defeat lies in your own hands. Any opponent who employs melee attacks, though, provides the opportunity of defeating themself. Use Thorns or Retaliate to turn your opponent's attacks against them.

Magic attacks are lethal from anywhere. They can cut through armor and find their mark against even the swiftest of targets. But Void, Phase, and Void Armor will dampen their effectiveness. Use any of these abilities to counter your opponent's magic attacks and win.
Anticipate your opponent's strategy and turn it against them. Practice using Oppress, Giant Killer, Deathblow, or Knock Out to multiply your damage and secure as many victories as possible.

Supreme excellence consists of breaking your opponent's resistance with minimal cost. Practice using Piercing or Stun to penetrate their armor and disable their attacks while winning as many arena battles as possible.
Some opponents will attempt to overwhelm you with damage. Use Demoralize, Silence, Headwinds, or Blind to impair their attacks and turn defeat into victory.

"Move like the wind. Attack like fire. Be impenetrable like a mountain. Endure like the Elder Tree." Basic tenets taught to aspiring battle mages, but still relevant at the highest leagues. Use Swiftness, Inspire, Protect, or Strengthen to hone your understanding of them.

To overwhelm one's opponent with tremendous force is not the pinnacle of skill. To subdue them without effort is the pinnacle of skill. Practice using Poison, Affliction, or Weaken to make each win appear effortless.
Sometimes the opportunity to defeat your opponent is provided by the opponent themself. Use Backfire, Return Fire, or Magic Reflect to turn their strength against them.

Practice leveraging spilled blood to strengthen your offense or whittle at your opponent's defense, building an insurmountable momentum. Use Bloodlust, Life Leech, Redemption, or Scavenger to capitalize on the carnage of battle.
Don't labor against your opponent's strengths. If they are secure at all points, seek to nullify their advantage. Use Shatter, Cripple, or Dispel to level the battlefield and obliterate them.
Win battles without the aid of Neutral monsters.

guild_store_items.name: Gladius Case
guild_store_items.short_desc: A pack that holds 5 Gladiator cards!

guild_store_items.name: Spy Glass
guild_store_items.short_desc: Sneak a peek at enemy Fray assignments.

guild_store_items.name: Blood Stone
guild_store_items.short_desc: Improve the drop rate of Gladiator Legendary cards!

guild_store_items.name: Power Stone
guild_store_items.short_desc: Improve the drop rate of Gladiator Gold Foil cards!
